title: Dependency Mapping with Jira Data in Miro
content: Set linkage in Jira (blocks, is blocked by, etc…) [Image] Bring children of the Epic into Miro Open Epic Next to your list of Child issues , click the Action Icon (…) and select View in search [Image] Highlight and copy (command + c) the JQL [Image] Open the Miro Board you intend to manage dependencies in On the left toolbar, click + (Add app) & search for and select Jira Cards [Image] In the Jira Cards App, paste (command + v) the JQL; ensure the Advanced Search is toggled On; select all issues by selecting the top check box; and click Add to import the Jira cards to the Miro board Tip: If you have more than 10 Issues in your list, be sure to scroll to the bottom of the screen to ensure all Issues populate BEFORE selecting all [Image][Image] Enable Dependencies in Miro In Miro’s top-of-screen toolbar, click the drop-down indicated by 2 downward arrows, and select Dependencies A Dependencies side-panel displays on the right-hand side of the Miro board. Here you can alter dependencies. Dependencies are visually represented by red lines. Drag and drop Jira Cards as desired on the Miro Board. [Image][Image]
